hints.content:
Partial products help us multiply larger numbers.

We can break the first factor apart by place value and multiply the parts *in any order* by the second factor. Then we add those products to get the final product.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

Let's take a look at how Lori broke apart the numbers to multiply.

options.explanation:
$542\times6$

We can break apart $542$ into $500 + 40 + 2$ and multiply each part by $6$.

We can start by multiplying $500\times6$ , $40\times6$, or $2\times6$. The order does not matter since we will be adding all the products together.

$\begin{array}{rr}
&\begin{align}
542&\\
\underline{{} \times 6}\end{align}\\
\text{any order}&\left\{\begin{align}
3{,}000\\
240\\
\underline{{}+12}\end{align}\right.\\
&3{,}252
\end{array}$
options.showPrompt: Can you show me an example please?

hints.content:
###Step $1$

$\begin{align}
\goldE8{,}092&\\
\underline{{} \times~~~ \goldE6}&\\
\goldE{48{,}000}&\qquad{\goldE{6\times8{,}000}}
\end{align}$

There are $8$ thousands in $8{,}092$, and $\goldE{6}\times\goldE{8{,}000}=\goldE{48{,}000}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $1$.

###Step $2$

$\begin{align}
8{,}\maroonE092&\\
\underline{{} \times~~~ \maroonE6}&\\
{48{,}000}&\qquad{{6\times8{,}000}}\\
\maroonE{0}&\qquad\maroonE{6\times 0}
\end{align}$

There are $0$ hundreds in $8{,}092$, and $\maroonE{6}\times\maroonE{0}=\maroonE{0}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $2$.

###Step $3$

$\begin{align}
8{,}0\tealE{9}2&\\
\underline{{} \times ~~~\tealE{6}}&\\
{48{,}000}&\qquad{{6\times8{,}000}}\\
{{}{0}}&\qquad{6\times 0}\\
{{}\tealE{540}}&\qquad \tealE{6} \times \tealE{90}
\end{align}$

There are $9$ tens in $8{,}092$, and $\tealE6\times\tealE{90}=\tealE{540}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $3$.

###Step $4$

$\begin{align}
8{,}09\blueE{2}&\\
\underline{{} \times \blueE{6}}&\\
{48{,}000}&\qquad{{6\times8{,}000}}\\
{{}{0}}&\qquad{6\times 0}\\
{540}&\qquad {6} \times 90\\
\underline{{}+\blueE{12}}&\qquad \blueE{6} \times \blueE{2}
\end{align}$

There are $2$ ones in $8{,}092$, and $\blueE6\times\blueE2=\blueE{12}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $4$.

###Step $5$

$\begin{align}
8{,}092&\\
\underline{{} \times~~~ 6}&\\
\purpleE{48{,}000}&\qquad{{6\times8{,}000}}\\
\purpleE{{}{0}}&\qquad{6\times 0}\\
\purpleE{540}&\qquad {6} \times 90\\
\underline{\purpleE{{}+12}}&\qquad{6\times 2}\\
\purpleE{48{,}552} 
\end{align}$

Lori said that $\purpleE{48{,}000 + 0 + 540 + 12}$ equals $\purpleE{552}$, so Lori made a mistake in step $5$.
Lori made a mistake in step $5$.

question.content:
Lori tried to evaluate $8{,}092\times6$ using partial products, but she made a mistake.  Her work is below.

$\begin{align}
&&8{,}092 \\
&&\underline{\times\phantom{22}6} \\
&\goldE{\text{Step 1}}&\goldE{{48{,}000}}&\qquad\goldE{6\times 8{,}000}\\
&\maroonE{\text{Step 2}}&\maroonE{{0}}&\qquad\maroonE{6\times 0}\\
&\tealE{\text{Step 3}}&\tealE{540} &\qquad\tealE{6\times 90}\\
&\blueE{\text{Step 4}}\quad&\underline{\blueE{{}+12}}&\qquad\blueE{6\times2}\\
&\purpleE{\text{Step 5}}&\purpleE{552}& &
 \end{align}$

**Find Lori's mistake.**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: There are $8$ thousands in $8{,}092$, and $\goldE{6}\times\goldE{8{,}000}=\goldE{48{,}000}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $1$.
There are $0$ hundreds in $8{,}092$, and $\maroonE{6}\times\maroonE{0}=\maroonE{0}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $2$.
There are $9$ tens in $8{,}092$, and $\tealE6\times\tealE{90}=\tealE{540}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $3$.
There are $2$ ones in $8{,}092$, and $\blueE6\times\blueE2=\blueE{12}$. So Lori did not make a mistake in step $4$.

Lori should add all four partial products instead of just the last two.
$48{,}000 + 0 + 540 + 12=48{,}552$
So Lori made a mistake in step $5$.
